Articles.Content:
I noticed that a similar problem was reported with the game message function where deployed sensors that did not have connection to kerbin would generate hundreds of messages while time warping. I have a similar problem, only I am receiving hundreds of messages every second even while not time warping. The problem is so bad that my game crashes after only minuets of being bombarded by these messages.  As you can see there are already 500 messages and I haven't had the game open for more than 30 seconds. If I continue to let the game run the messages eventually just overload my computer and the game crashes.

Is there anything I can do to fix this?

There are no fixes as yet. Once you deploy a seismic sensor on the Mun which then becomes low-powered or unpowered due to lack of sunlight, and then have an impactor on the Mun, you've broken your career save - as this will start generating hundreds of messages per minute. 

The only workaround I've seen is manually deleting entries in game files. But this doesn't fix the problem of generation.

What version of the game are you using? I am on 1.7.3 and have not encountered the problem, even though I do have a seismic detector on the Mun and Minmus which both get underpowered while on the night side.

I would still welcome a mod that completely disables the contract messaging system as I have accumulated literally two thousand of them, every time I accidentally hover my mouse over the messages button my game freezes for like 5 seconds, and I am not willing to click them away one by one. It would also solve your problem. Does anyone know about something like that?

Edited July 24, 2019 by Aelipse
